front.title: Extensions to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) for Network Asserted Identity within Trusted Networks

abstract.t: This document describes extensions to SIP that enable a network oftrusted SIP servers to assert the identity of end users or endsystems, and to convey indications of end-user requested privacy.The use of these extensions are only applicable inside anadministrative domain, or among federations of administrative domainswith previously agreed-upon policies for usage of such information.This document does NOT offer a general privacy or identity modelsuitable for inter-domain use or use in the Internet at large.
